reviews.text: We had a suite with kitchenette, 1.5 baths, and 2 Tvs, plus pool and jacuzzi, all for $60 per night (off season). A steal considering it's P-town. The hotel is a little far to the center, but you would pay a lot more to stay in just a bedroom at a guesthouse in the center. The furnishings are a little dated but okay, though flat screen TVs would be nice. The wifi worked well for my companion, though I had difficulty. I am not sure why. I have to say how nice, friendly, and helpful the staff was. They make you feel right at home.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms at excellent prices

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find such a gem for the low price that I paid. Though the room was small it was very clean and comfortable. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and we loved the proximity to the beach. Definitely knew I picked the right place when my girl begged me to come back again soon.
reviews.title: What a steal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Eastwood at Provincetown during January, and was impressed with the accomodations. Without prompting, the staff upgraded our room, and allowed us to check-in early, and check out a bit late. While this is likely due to the slow winter season, it was much appreciated. The room was great, and the location was good. Provincetown, while fun in the summer, is also beautiful in the winter. In either season, I would highly recommend Eastwood at Provincetown.
reviews.title: Lovely Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we came here though out time share and were very well pleased. The rooms are simple, but adequate and the staff is pleasant and knowledgeable. Very quite area, and pleasant surroundings. Can here the peeper frogs and can easilly walk into provincetown and to the dunes. At the tip of Cape Cod and very pleased with out condo Outdoor pool only available in season. Games room has pool, badminton and other games as well as a library of books to read.
reviews.title: quite, lovely condo in a beautiful setting

reviews.text: Three of us stayed at the Eastwood over Easter weekend,and were impressed with the accomadations and and how the owner and staff thought of almost everything guests would or could use in the rooms.
reviews.title: Well worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eastwood would be perfect for a family spending a few days summering in Provincetown. It is almost apartment style, with 1 1/2 bath, a full kitchen and living/dining room. For a couple spending the night though it is somewhat lacking. Simple amenities like having a hairdryer, a full roll of toilet paper or towels that aren't frayed were not part of our stay. The location would be better if it were a little closer to the town center or within view of the beach. There was not a front desk worker when we arrived. Overall, the price of this hotel and the size of the rooms make it a good choice for a summer retreat, just pack well.
reviews.title: Great for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I spent a weekend at the Eastwood. It was a pleasant little getaway. Originally we were supposed to get the Queen Studio, but we were upgraded to the Queen bedroom. It was very cozy and furnished so that it was very accomidating. Sandy the hostess is a gem! We enjoyed ourselves so much that we are going back for Easter weekend.
reviews.title: A Great Little Getaway

reviews.text: It worked for my family. We had a pullout sofa in one room and a queen bed in the other. There was a full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. We were on the 2nd floor with a walkway connecting all the rooms. The place is an older hotel conversion and the furniture was older but the rooms were clean. The grounds were well kept and the parking convenient. The outdoor pool was nice (not heated) and there was an old game room and a newer fitness room. We enjoyed the pleasant 1.1 miles walk into Provincetown. Make sure to take the street closest to the water, its safer and more scenic. The bay access was just a couple minutes walk and you get a great view of Provincetown.
reviews.title: A nice place for a family to stay for a week

reviews.text: The tide goes out very far. We cooked most of the time and had the supermarket steam 3lb lobsters for us.
reviews.title: Bad Interval Trade
